text: That's about solo travel.
Today's topic is .. Is solo travel lonely?

There's a high probability that you're are
already considering traveling alone, for many
different reasons.

You're having difficulty aligning your schedule
with your friends.

No one wants to go to the same countries that
you want to go to.

You can't find friends with the same travel
style or the same budget as you.

Finally, you're tired and fed up of having
to wait on other people to start your travel
dreams.
Those were all my reasons.

Which kickstarted me into the idea of traveling
alone.

But likewise there were all these worries
and self doubts about whether or not I could
do it.
Will I be able to get around by myself?
Will I have to eat all my dinners alone?

What if I get into a really bad situation
and there's no one to help me?
People often think solo travel is lonely.

That's what freaked me out and turned me off
to solo travel for a very long time.

A lot of people assume that SOLO means you
must be LONELY
because SOLO = ALONE and ALONE= LONELY.
It doesn't actually work like that.

The only thing that' s alone about traveling
solo is making decisions and being responsible
for those choices on your own.

Just because you got onto a plane by yourself
doesn't mean you're gonna be traveling all
alone.

In fact if your'e traveling alone, your propensity
to meet other people is gonna be greater than
if you're traveling with other people.

Traveling alone makes me more approachable
to others.

Lot of people feel more sympathy to solo travelers
especially if they're female.

You're probably thinking to yourself- but
I'm really shy, Chris.
What if I can't make any friends.
If you're shy...
It forces you out of your shell.

Forces you to be forward and outgoing and
direct about your needs.
It has nothing to do with being confident.
It's all about survival.

Because you need directions to where you're
going, help to translate signs, the only way
you can get it is to speak to other people,..
You will do it!
Without even thinking.
As a
solo traveler, I'm befriending my environment.

it's the only friend I've got and the only
resource I can reach out to.
So it has to be home.

When I need help, the strangers that are around
me, the locals, other travelers...
they become my resources.
completely different world.

When you make your environment your best friend...
then it creates a broader experience of travel.
You become naturally more social.
When you travel alone, the world is your buffet.
And you can pick and choose what you want.

You 
pick and choose what you want in your experience.
Then there are times,...
I just want to walk around and be by myself.

That means I'm relying on locals to help me
get around.

When you travel alone you can create and mold
your world to the way you want it to be.
it's become a huge social life for me.

I will share tips and tricks on how to make
friends when you're alone on the road.
